overview.about: Berlin is the capital and largest city of Germany. It has a population of over 3.7 million people and is known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and diverse nightlife. The city has been at the center of some of the most significant events in modern history, including the rise and fall of the Berlin Wall, and today it is a hub for art, music, and innovation.

extra_activities.title: Visit the Berlin Wall
extra_activities.description: This iconic monument stands as a powerful reminder of Germany's history and the division of Berlin during the Cold War.

extra_activities.title: Explore the Museum Island
extra_activities.description: Home to several world-class museums, including the Pergamon Museum and the Alte Nationalgalerie, the Museum Island is a must-visit for art and history enthusiasts.

extra_activities.title: Take a bike tour of the city
extra_activities.description: Biking is a popular way to see the city's top sights, including the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, and the Tiergarten park.

extra_activities.title: Visit the Reichstag Building
extra_activities.description: This historic building is home to the German parliament and offers stunning views of the city from its glass dome.

extra_activities.title: Experience the nightlife
extra_activities.description: Berlin is known for its vibrant and diverse nightlife, with countless bars, clubs, and music venues catering to all tastes and styles.

activity_data.description: Explore the history of the Berlin Wall on this guided bike tour. Cycle along the wall's path and learn about its construction, fall, and the impact it had on Berlin and the world. You'll see iconic landmarks like Checkpoint Charlie and the Brandenburg Gate along the way.

sections.title: BANKING AND CURRENCY
sections.information: In Berlin, the official currency is the Euro (EUR). Most banks and ATMs accept major credit cards and travelers checks. Currency exchange services can be found at airports, train stations, and major tourist areas. It is always recommended to check the exchange rate before making any currency exchange.

sections.title: ELECTRICITY AND PLUG STANDARDS
sections.information: In Berlin, the electrical voltage is 220-240V AC, 50Hz. The plug type used is the European standard plug, which has two round pins. It is recommended to bring a universal adapter if your devices use a different type of plug.
